00032 // Interface for Byte type. 
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 9/7/94
00035 
00036 #ifndef _byte_h
00037 #define _byte_h 1
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #ifndef _dods_datatypes_h
00046 #include "dods-datatypes.h"
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 #ifndef _basetype_h
00050 #include "BaseType.h"
00051 #endif
00052 
00059 class Byte: public BaseType {
00065     friend class Int16;
00066     friend class UInt16;
00067     friend class Int32;
00068     friend class UInt32;
00069     friend class Float32;
00070     friend class Float64;
00071 
00072 protected:
00073     dods_byte _buf;
00074 
00075 public:
00076   Byte(const string &n = "");
00077 
00078   virtual ~Byte() {}
00079   
00080   Byte(const Byte &copy_from);
00081 
00082   Byte &operator=(const Byte &rhs);
00083 
00084   virtual unsigned int width();
00085 
00086     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00087 
00088     bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink, bool ce_eval);
00089     bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *, bool);
00090 
00091   virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00092   virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00093   
00094   virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "", 
00095              bool print_decl_p = true);
00096 
00097     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "", 
00098                bool print_decl_p = true);
00099 
00100     virtual bool ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset);
00101 };

00152  * Revision 1.30.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:41  jimg
00153  * Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00154  * I added those where they were needed.
00155  * In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00156  * just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00157  * before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00158  * just good form when using delete.
00159  * I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00160  * making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00161  * set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00162  * comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00163  * characters on their own.
00164  *

00167  * the start. Also made the ifdef guard symbols use the same naming scheme and
00168  * wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00169  * down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00170  *
00171  * Revision 1.29  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00172  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00173  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00174  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00175  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00176  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00177  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00233  * deserialize mfuncs. Connect was also modified so that it manages the data
00234  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).

00243  * in the future.

00268  * Removed old, deprecated member functions.
00269  * Changed the names of read_val and store_val to buf2val and val2buf.
00270  *
00271  * Revision 1.9  1995/03/04  14:34:57  jimg
00272  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00273  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00274  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00275  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00276  * class represenation.
00277  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00278  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00279  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ string object).
00280  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00281  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00282  * C would store them.
00283  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00284  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00285  * objects).
00286  *
00287  * Revision 1.8  1995/02/10  02:22:40  jimg
00288  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00289  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00290  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00291  * will be removed in a future release.
00292  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00293  * internal buffer.
00294  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00295  * Fixed read_val().
00296  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00297  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00298  * Fixed print_val().
00299  *
00300  * Revision 1.7  1995/01/19  21:59:12  jimg
00301  * Added read_val from dummy_read.cc to the sample set of sub-class
00302  * implementations.
00303  * Changed the declaration of readVal in BaseType so that it names the
00304  * mfunc read_val (to be consistant with the other mfunc names).
00305  * Removed the unnecessary duplicate declaration of the abstract virtual
00306  * mfuncs read and (now) read_val from the classes Byte, ... Grid. The
00307  * declaration in BaseType is sufficient along with the decl and definition
00308  * in the *.cc,h files which contain the subclasses for Byte, ..., Grid.
